newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU's monetary committee to hold scheduled meeting.
newsitem.headline: EU's monetary committee to hold scheduled meeting.

text.p: The European Union's monetary committee is to hold a scheduled meeting on Tuesday, monetary sources said on Friday.
The sources would not say whether the top central bank and treasury officials who usually attend would discuss the return of the lira to the Exchange Rate Merchanism (ERM).
Major ERM decisions like currency realignments or admission of new members are usually taken at weekends.
The agenda of the meeting involves further discussions on a stability pact for the future European single currency and a new ERM for the countries which are not part of the Euro from the start.

Italian Prime Minister Romano Prodi said after a meeting with French President Jacques Chirac on Friday that Italy would ask for "immediate, rapid" talks on the level at which the lira will be readmitted.
The lira was forced out of the ERM in September 1992 together with the pound after intense market speculation. -- Brussels newsroom 322 2876841
